marketNews.title: Finance Minister Optimistic about Indonesia Economy +5.5% YoY in Q4 2025
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said on Tuesday (30/9) that he is optimistic Indonesia's economic growth in Q4 2025 can reach +5.5% YoY. The growth, according to Purbaya, will occur across the board, but will be most visible in the property sector – driven by increased bank credit disbursement – and in the food and beverage sector due to higher economic activity. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto also expressed optimism for Q4 2025 growth, which he expects to be driven by government spending including fiscal stimulus during the Christmas and New Year holidays amounting to about 2 billion US dollars or roughly 30 trillion rupiah. By comparison, a Bloomberg consensus survey in September 2025 projected Indonesia's Q4 2025 growth at only +4.7% YoY. In a separate statement, Purbaya emphasized that he will not consider loosening the fiscal deficit limit until the economy grows faster with more efficient spending. On Wednesday (1/10), BPS released inflation and trade balance data that exceeded consensus expectations. Indonesia's inflation in September 2025 was recorded at 2.65% YoY (vs. August 2025: 2.31% YoY, September 2024: 1.84% YoY), higher than the consensus estimate of 2.5% YoY. Core inflation was 2.19% YoY in September 2025 (vs. August 2025: 2.17% YoY, September 2024: 2.09% YoY), slightly below the consensus estimate of 2.2% YoY. The trade surplus reached USD 5.49 billion in August 2025 (vs. July 2025: USD 4.17 billion, August 2024: USD 2.76 billion), surpassing the consensus forecast of USD 3.99 billion. This result was driven by export growth of +5.78% YoY in August 2025, above the consensus level of +5% YoY, while imports fell -6.56% YoY, lower than the consensus expectation of -2% YoY. Key Takeaway: We assess that core inflation remains low and credit growth is still slow, indicating that up to August 2025 there are no clear signs of increased consumer purchasing power or demand. Therefore, investors should monitor the impact of various government initiatives – such as liquidity injections, fiscal stimulus, and overall increased government spending – as well as Bank Indonesia's interest rate cuts. Meanwhile, the release of trade balance data and news of a US government shutdown appear to provide positive sentiment for the rupiah, which on Wednesday (1/10) strengthened by +0.3% to 16,610 per US dollar.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content: The United States experienced a government shutdown on Wednesday (1/10) after the Senate failed to pass a federal budget, marking the first shutdown since 2018-2019. OPEC+ is considering accelerating oil production increases by about 500,000 barrels per day in a meeting on 5 October 2025, potentially raising output by up to 1.66 million barrels per day over three months, though the final decision is not yet confirmed. S&P Global reported that Indonesia's manufacturing PMI eased to 50.4 in September 2025 (vs. 49.2 in September 2024), indicating expansion for the second consecutive month, while China's manufacturing PMI rose to 51.2 in September 2025 (vs. 49.3 in September 2024), the highest since March 2025. Danantara announced the launch of 33 waste-to-energy projects, with eight to be launched by the end of October 2025, each handling at least 1,000 tons of waste per day to generate 15 MW for 20,000 households. AGII shareholder Matrix Company Limited sold approximately 6.83 million shares at an average price of 764 rupiah, reducing its stake from 32.45% to 32.23%. Wir Asia shareholder PT Wir Global Kreatif sold 44.5 million WIRG shares at an average price of about 138 rupiah, lowering its ownership from roughly 5.02% to 4.65%. BPS reported that foreign tourist arrivals reached about 1.5 million in August 2025 (+12.3% YoY), bringing the 8M25 total to roughly 10 million, 63-72% of the 2025 government target.

tickerNews.title: NISP 8M25 Net Profit Bank Only Declines 4% YoY
tickerNews.content: $NISP: Bank OCBC NISP recorded net profit bank only of 427 billion rupiah in August 2025 (+34% YoY, -4% MoM), resulting in an 8M25 bank-only net profit of 3.4 trillion rupiah (-4% YoY). The August profit was supported by a 25% YoY increase in PPOP and non-interest income rising to 250 billion rupiah (vs. 9 billion rupiah in August 2024), as well as other non-operational income of 1.9 billion rupiah (vs. a loss of 80 billion rupiah in August 2024). During 8M25, profit was pressured by provisions of 158 billion rupiah (vs. a reversal of provisions of 500 billion rupiah in August 2024), although PPOP still grew 14% YoY. Net interest income rose 3% YoY over 8M25, but the growth trend slowed compared with the April-June 2025 period, which was in the +5-7% YoY range.

tickerNews.title: ANTM Invests $159.6 Million in PT Feni Haltim
tickerNews.content: $ANTM: Aneka Tambang announced that it has contributed capital of 159.6 million US dollars (approximately 2.6 trillion rupiah) to its joint-venture subsidiary PT Feni Haltim, which is co-owned with Hong Kong-based CBL Ltd. PT Feni Haltim is currently constructing the RKEF smelter with a capacity of 88,000 tons of nickel pig iron per year. In this transaction, Hong Kong CBL Ltd. also added capital of 3.95 trillion rupiah, leaving ANTM’s ownership stake in PT Feni Haltim unchanged at 40%.

tickerNews.title: MMLP Acquired by Astra International via PT Saka Industrial Arjaya
tickerNews.content: $MMLP: Astra International ($ASII) through its subsidiary PT Saka Industrial Arjaya announced that the acquisition price for Mega Manunggal Property is 580.6 rupiah per share, resulting in a total transaction value of 3.3 trillion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya becomes the new controlling shareholder of MMLP and will carry out a mandatory tender offer. Previously, ASII announced that its subsidiary PT Saka Industrial Arjaya had signed an agreement to acquire 83.67% of MMLP shares from PT Suwarna Arta Mandiri, Bridge Leed Limited, and other minority shareholders on 22 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: COCO Rights Issue Pricing and Dilution Details
tickerNews.content: $COCO: Wahana Interfood Nusantara announced that the rights issue price is 100 rupiah per share. In this corporate action, COCO will issue approximately 2.67 billion new shares with a 1:3 ratio, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 75%. The potential proceeds amount to about 267 billion rupiah, which will be used for capital expenditures to develop the business, especially in the midstream sector, and for working capital. The controlling shareholder, Mahogany Global Investment Pte. Ltd., will exercise all its rights and act as a standby buyer for approximately 868.5 million new shares. The rights will be cum-rights in the regular market and negotiable on 8 October 2025, while the rights trading period is from 14 to 20 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Insider Alexander Ramlie Sells 20 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: Amman Mineral International commissioner Alexander Ramlie sold 20 million AMMN shares at an average price of 7,675 rupiah per share on 19 September 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 153.5 billion rupiah and was intended for share pledge restructuring. After this transaction, Ramlie’s ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.462% to 0.435%.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Board and Commissioner Changes Approved
tickerNews.content: $DEWA: Shareholders of Darma Henwa approved changes to the board of directors and commissioners on Tuesday (30/9). Joseph Lembayung was appointed as Director of Digital Transformation and Information Technology, a new role to support digitalization plans. Wisnu Wahyudin Pettalolo and Sorimuda Pulungan were appointed as commissioners, while Agus Suharyono was appointed as an independent commissioner. The extraordinary shareholders’ meeting also respectfully dismissed Ashok Mitra from his commissioner position and Kanaka Puradiredja from his independent commissioner role.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Establishes New Subsidiary PT Solusi Sinergi Borneo
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: Solusi Sinergi Digital announced the establishment of a new subsidiary named PT Solusi Sinergi Borneo (SSB), with WIFI holding 70% ownership and PT Sinergi Integrasi Borneo holding the remaining 30%. SSB will focus on internet service provider activities, telecommunications equipment trading, and various other goods trading, aiming to support the expansion and growth of the company’s business.

tickerNews.title: RMKE Shares Sold by PT RMK Investama
tickerNews.content: $RMKE: RMK Energy controlling shareholder, PT RMK Investama, sold 875 million RMKE shares at an average price of 890 rupiah per share between 29 and 30 September 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 778.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT RMK Investama’s ownership in RMKE decreased from 76.8% to 56.8%.
